block.p: Sonia Patrice Lassiter, the daughter of Evelyn and Herbert Lassiter of Ahoskie, N.C., was married yesterday to James Hugo Shelton III, a son of Joan McKinley Shelton and James Shelton, both of Washington. The Rev. H. Beecher Hicks performed the ceremony at the Metropolitan Baptist Church in Washington.

Mrs. Shelton, 30, is a candidate for a Ph.D. in sociology at Duke University and is working in New York on her dissertation, which compares the academic successes of African-American middle-school students from differing socioeconomic backgrounds. She graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in sociology from Duke. Her father retired as a bus driver for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority in New York. Her mother is a case worker for the North Carolina Department of Social Services in Winton.

She graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in sociology from Duke. Her father retired as a bus driver for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority in New York. Her mother is a case worker for the North Carolina Department of Social Services in Winton.

Mr. Shelton, 33, is the president of LearnNow Inc., a company in New York that works with community-based organizations to open and manage charter schools. A graduate of Morehouse College, he received an M.B.A. and a master's degree in education from Stanford. His mother, a retired gerontologist, worked for the Health and Human Services Department in Washington. His father, also retired, was a Postal Service clerk in Washington.
